CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-3 - Length of pre-trial detention)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is detained in PERSON , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of large - scale embezzlement .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was formally charged with the crime .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE remanded the applicant in custody pending investigation . The judge found that ( CARDINAL ) the applicant was suspected of a serious crime , ( CARDINAL ) his involvement in embezzlement was confirmed by the evidential material in the case file , ( CARDINAL ) he might put pressure on witnesses or ( CARDINAL ) he might interfere with investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Zavodskoy ORG of GPE extended the applicant ’s pre - trial detention . The court referred to the gravity of the charges and reiterated that the applicant might threaten witnesses or interfere with investigation . It also observed that the applicant might reoffend or abscond .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the detention order of DATE on appeal .
CARDINAL . The applicant remained in custody pending investigation and trial until his release on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was found guilty of the charge .
